alert.note: Alert for Oneida (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 4:40PM MDT until August 13 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR CENTRAL ONEIDA COUNTY... At 440 PM MDT, Doppler radar continues to show light to moderate rainfall across the warned area. Although the heaviest rain has already fallen, radar estimates continue to show 1.5-2.5 inches of rain have fallen to the east of Holbrook. Additional light rainfall on top of already saturated soils, may lead to some additional flash flooding threat over the next hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, roads, and basements, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Holbrook Summit and Holbrook. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
